perturbation.original_text:
5. PAYMENT.
5.1 ADVERTISING FEES.  After the Launch Date,
i-Escrow shall pay 2TheMart advertising fees based
on the number of Transaction Inquiries. This advertising
fees shall consist of a per Transaction Inquiry
amount calculated by multiplying 0.025% by
the amount of the average Transaction from
all Customers in the preceding quarter. The
formula for arriving at the per Transaction
Inquiry amount may be revised from time to
time during the term of this Agreement to
reflect present market conditions ("the
Adjusted Rate"), but only by mutual
consent of the parties after good faith discussions.
The Adjusted Rate shall be added as an
addendum to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
5. PAYMENT.
5.1 ADVERTISING FEES.  After the Launch Date,
i-Escrow shall pay 2TheMart advertising fees based
on the number of Transaction Inquiries. This advertising
fees shall consist of a per Transaction Inquiry
amount calculated by multiplying 0.025% by
the amount of the average Transaction from
all Customers in the preceding quarter. The
formula for arriving at the per Transaction
Inquiry amount may be revised from time to
time during the term of this Agreement to
reflect present market conditions ("the
Adjusted Rate"), unilaterally by 2TheMart.
The Adjusted Rate shall be added as an
addendum to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that the Adjusted Rate can be revised unilaterally by 2TheMart, conflicting with the original clause that requires mutual consent of both parties. This creates uncertainty about how the advertising fees will be determined and gives 2TheMart undue control over the payment terms, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
5.3 AUDIT RIGHTS. i-Escrow shall keep for one (1) year proper
records and books of account relating to the
computation of advertising payments owed to
2TheMart (including, as appropriate, the
computation of the size of average
Transaction).  Once every twelve (12)
months, 2TheMart through a CPA may inspect
and audit such records to verify reports.
Any such inspection will be conducted in a
manner that does not unreasonably interfere
with i-Escrow's business activities and with
no less than fifteen (15) days notice.
i-Escrow shall within two (2) weeks make any
overdue payments disclosed by the audit.
Such inspection shall be at 2TheMart's
expense; however, if the audit reveals
overdue payments in excess of ten percent
(10%) of the payments owed to date, i-Escrow
shall immediately pay all cost of such
audit.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.3 AUDIT RIGHTS. i-Escrow shall keep for one (1) year proper
records and books of account relating to the
computation of advertising payments owed to
2TheMart (including, as appropriate, the
computation of the size of average
Transaction).  Once every twelve (12)
months, 2TheMart through a CPA may inspect
and audit such records to verify reports. Any such inspection will be conducted in a
manner that i-Escrow deems reasonable, regardless of interference with i-Escrow's business activities, with no less than five (5) days notice.
i-Escrow shall within thirty (30) days make any
overdue payments disclosed by the audit.
Such inspection shall be at 2TheMart's
expense; however, if the audit reveals
overdue payments in excess of five percent
(5%) of the payments owed to date, i-Escrow
shall immediately pay all cost of such
audit.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation introduces multiple conflicting terms regarding the audit rights. The changed text allows inspections regardless of interference, reduces the notice period from 15 to 5 days, extends the overdue payment deadline from 2 weeks to 30 days, and lowers the threshold for i-Escrow to pay for the audit from 10% to 5%. These changes contradict the original terms meant to protect i-Escrow's business activities and creates ambiguity about the audit process.

perturbation.original_text:
8.5 EFFECTS OF TERMINATION.  Upon expiration or termination
of this Agreement for any reason: (a) all rights granted
herein shall terminate, (b) i-Escrow shall pay all amounts
owed to 2TheMart within six (6) weeks of termination,
and (c) each party shall remove the other party's content
and Marks from their servers.  Notwithstanding the
foregoing, unless this Agreement was terminated for a
material breach, all provisions of this Agreement shall
survive to the extent necessary for i-Escrow to complete
any Customer transactions which are pending at the time
of expiration or termination.  Sections 1, 7,  8.5  [EFFECTS OF TERMINATION], 9,
10, 11 and 12 shall survive expiration or
termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.5 EFFECTS OF TERMINATION.  Upon expiration or termination
of this Agreement for any reason: (a) all rights granted
herein shall terminate, (b) i-Escrow shall pay all amounts
owed to 2TheMart within twelve (12) weeks of termination,
and (c) each party shall remove the other party's content
and Marks from their servers.  Notwithstanding the
foregoing, even if this Agreement was terminated for a
material breach, all provisions of this Agreement shall
survive to the extent necessary for i-Escrow to complete
any Customer transactions which are pending at the time
of expiration or termination.  Sections 1, 7,  8.5  [EFFECTS OF TERMINATION], 9,
10, 11 and 12 shall survive expiration or
termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces conflicting terms about the obligations after termination. It extends the payment deadline for i-Escrow from six weeks to twelve weeks and removes the exception for material breach regarding the survival of provisions. These changes create uncertainty about the payment terms and obligations for ongoing transactions after termination and contradict the initial intention to penalize material breaches. One section is extending time, and the other is removing restrictions.
